comments.body: It'll be clearer to say "got type: ".

Sure, I was actually borrowing the pattern from [right above it](https://github.com/critiqjo/tensorflow/blob/84f0cce/tensorflow/contrib/seq2seq/python/ops/helper.py#L337-L338). Should I change that too?
OK. In that case never mind. On second thought, the alternative I suggested was not 100% clear, either. What you have is fine and shorter.

diffHunk:

    if not isinstance(outputs, ops.Tensor):
      raise TypeError("Expected outputs to be a single Tensor, got: %s" %
                      type(outputs))
